critique: This document is a presidential order waiving examination requirements for a specific individual to be appointed to a position in the Post Office Department. It is recommended by the Postmaster General and cites the Civil Service Act as its authority. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The only axis that seems relevant is executive power, as the order allows for an exception to civil service rules, potentially expanding executive discretion in appointments. However, this is a very specific case and doesn't represent a broad expansion of power.
